comments:
i20040209

1 - Open the target platform pref page
2 - clear the location for the target platform
3 - Hit reload
4 - close the preferences dialog
5 - open the same page

1st problem: there is no easy way for the user to say: I want the default
location back (restore default should do that, but does not seem to be working).

2nd problem: after doing steps 2-4, there is no way of explicitly selecting a
new location and reloading the list of plugins. It will stay empty until next
Eclipse session.

If you do the steps above, some interesting things may happen while trying to
launch a PDE related launch configuration (the stack trace below is logged, will
attach error dialog), or even opening the launch config dialog (after showing an
internal error dialog, the right pane of the launch config dialog will be blank).

!ENTRY org.eclipse.pde.core 4 4 Feb 11, 2004 12:48:30.248

Created an attachment (id=7789)
error dialog

This error dialog is shown when launching PDE JUnit launch config after having
left the platform target field empty. Setting it to anything else (other than
an empty string) will cause better messages to be logged:

When setting the location to something that is not a valid install location:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.pde.core 2 1 Feb 11, 2004 12:53:39.00
!MESSAGE Problems while scanning external plug-ins
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.core.runtime 2 1 Feb 11, 2004 12:53:39.00

When trying to run a PDE-related launch config with this invalid location:

!MESSAGE Unable to resolve plug-in registry.
!ENTRY org.eclipse.pde.ui 4 0 Feb 11, 2004 12:53:41.781
!MESSAGE Launching failed. Required Library "startup.jar" is missing from the
target platform.

"Restore Defaults" will now give you the host platform as the target platform.

the NPE has been fixed (bug 49029)
